Key specs, filter types, and room-size tips for choosing an air purifier.

## What matters
- Match the CADR and square-foot rating to your room size.
- Prefer true HEPA filters; add activated carbon when odors or smoke are concerns.
- Check noise levels (dB) at sleep and max settings.
- Look for filter change indicators and readily available replacements.

## Quick setup tips
Place units away from walls and corners, run on high for the first hour, then balance noise and airflow. Replace filters on the manufacturer cadence or sooner if air quality drops.

Navigation types, suction, and maintenance steps to pick a reliable robot vacuum.

## What matters
- Navigation: lidar maps faster and handles edges; bump-and-go is cheaper but slower.
- Suction and brush design affect hair pickup; look for detachable rollers for easy cleaning.
- Battery life and auto-dock behavior set how well it covers larger floors.
- App features: room naming, no-go lines, and multi-floor maps help avoid trouble spots.

## Maintenance checklist
Empty the bin after each run, wash filters monthly if washable, and trim hair from rollers weekly to keep suction steady.

What matters

  • App features: room naming, no-go lines, and multi-floor maps help avoid trouble spots.

Capacity, controls, and cleanup factors to choose the right air fryer.

## What matters
- Capacity: 4–6 qt suits 2–4 people; go larger for sheet-pan style meals.
- Controls: analog dials are simple; presets plus temperature probes add precision.
- Basket vs. oven style: baskets circulate air quickly; oven styles fit more and toast better.
- Materials: look for dishwasher-safe baskets and removable trays for easier degreasing.

## Quick safety notes
Preheat briefly, avoid aerosol sprays that damage nonstick, and keep space around vents for airflow.

Sizing, drainage, and noise points for picking a home dehumidifier.

## What matters
- Capacity: match the pint rating to room size and moisture level; larger units cycle less often.
- Drainage: continuous hose drain prevents bucket emptying; pumps help when the drain is above the unit.
- Filters: reusable mesh filters keep coils clean; rinse monthly.
- Noise and efficiency: check decibel ratings and ENERGY STAR certification for lower operating costs.

## Placement tips
Keep doors/windows closed in the target area, leave clearance around the intake and exhaust, and route hoses with a smooth downward run to avoid clogs.
